page.title: 10VILLAGE SCHOOL HISTORY.
page.content: education.Grants were given to set up public education for children.It was decided to close the CHARITY SCHOOL and build a new school,so qualifying for a Government grant. {JAMES MOILLIET,}then lord of the Manor,was the leading figure in the provision of a new school.His son,{ {JOHN LEWIS MOILLIET}<a student at CAmbridge>,later became Rector of Abberley and much involved with the running of the school.A piece of land provided by the WALSHES TRUST, was purchased nearly opposite the old school.The new {PAROCHIAL SCHOOL}was erected in 1859.It was built of Abberley stone <from the nearby quarry>,in the Early English style.It was designed to cater for children aged 5 to 14years.The school then had a certificated teacher,a governess, a sewing mistress and a pupil teacher
